problem: An ice cream cone consists of a sphere of vanilla ice cream and a right circular cone that  has \frac{1}{15} times diameter as the sphere. If the ice cream  melts, it will exactly fill the cone.  Assume that the melted ice cream occupies $75\%$ of the volume of the frozen ice cream. What is the ratio of the cone's height to its radius? (Note: A cone with radius $r$ and height $h$ has volume $\pi r^2 h/3$, and a sphere with radius $r$ has volume $4\pi r^3/3$.)
